sense.name: a mathematical relation which is a well-defined mapping between two sets
sense.examples: This math course will cover probability density functions and cumulative dsitribution functions. A set of values where each value is mapped to itself is the identity function.

sense.name: a dependancy between phenomena
sense.commentary: FUNCTION[+relation][+dependancy][+approximate][+between_entities] Note: this sense is related to Sense 1, but is usually not as quantitatively rigorous, more of an approximation based on empirical sampling.
sense.examples: These diseases are largely a function of stress. Height is a function of age. The sociologist said that class shame was a function of social power. Mary's mood swings seem to be a function of how much sleep she gets.

sense.name: the purpose or utility of something
sense.examples: The function of a hammer is to drive nails. At some basic level, the function of a bridge and a tunnel are the same.

sense.name: the essential duty or responsibility of an occupation
sense.examples: The function of a good drill sergeant is to turn recruits into soldiers ready for combat. Providing the guiding vision of a company is the function of the CEO.

sense.name: a social occasion, often official or formal
sense.examples: John is taking Sally to some black-tie function on Saturday night. It was just a boring corporate function with people standing around trying to network.

sense.name: the processing or operation of something
sense.examples: Vitamin A is required for normal eye function. A computer performed the function of calculating the rocket's orbit.
